reviewText: Datswer plays like an amateur Prince of Persia fangame that should never have left Newgrounds.  Glitches out the wazoo, a clumsy non-rebindable control scheme, and inconsistent platforming mechanics make this one to avoid.  The sheer incompetence and snippets of mangled English do offer some unintentional hilarity, but even so, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game.\n\nWell okay, maybe if you run a YouTube channel and need a bad game to entertain your subscribers, but to the average consumer, stay away!

reviewText: Once you die once the game will not let you continue.  It's fundamentally broken.\nThey didn't even change the text: The protagonist of this Android game..." for the Steam release."

reviewText: I'm sorry that I upvoted this broken, glitchy pile of poo. The only thing good about Datswer is the art style, everything else is horrible! It freezes, task manager says its running, but you can't move. The controls are atrocious and there are no setting options. Too bad really, the look of the game is unique, but its completely broken and unplayable. Another horrible GL game that I have had the misfortune of trying" to play.0/10"

reviewText:
While the developer seems to be trying really hard to make the game better, as of update 2.5.1, the game still has terrible controls (like a phone game - click once to move, twice to run, click on the character and select again to crouch, jump forward or jump).

Cons:

- I could only play the game by moving the executable to the game's main folder. Otherwise, Steam would not even see the .exe file.
- Terrible controls with the mouse (a platformer without controller or keyboard support is a game-breaker for me)
- a horrible bug after dying that made my character get stuck above the checkpoint (I have uploaded a picture to Steam)
- bad English (the Continue option means Reload Checkpoint, which does not make sense, just to give an example)

Pros

- nice graphics style
- nice audio effects

I really want to play this game, and hope I can change my review in the future.

reviewText: This game is similar to Another World, a platformer exploration game with sudden deaths.\n\nThe main problem with this game is the buggy platforming. Sometimes you can jump into an object and get stuck. If you cancel a climb animation while hanging on an edge, you will get stuck. These will force you to load the last save point.

reviewText: The trailer makes it look fun, but its too glitchy to play. I hope the bugs can get worked out and, if possible, controller support be added.

Datswer is a  pleasant slow moving platformer, with puzzle elements, that should keep   the average platformer enthusiast  happily  entertained for a while.  It's not frenetic like Super Meat Boy, but  slow and  almost  hypnotic in its movement. The  graphics are not brilliant, but   the art style, which is a pastiche of muted  colors and styles reminicient of several other  platformers i've played over the years (notably Gish)  is   somehow  pleasing and  really  drew  me into the game.   The next thing I knew three hours had passed.

There are numerous enemies,  traps,  paths, chasms, pits and obstacles to avoid   while exploring the cave system that  you find yourself in.   You also have  to interact with many of the objects you find within the cave as they may be required to solve one of the many puzzles you will  be faced with while exploring the cave system.  If you get stuck,  you can find  useful hints and tips  via the developers face book page, which you can find HERE; also you can see a You Tube video of  game play HERE. I'm sure if you look you'll also find  video walkthroughs which can always be helpful if you get totally lost.  :)

For the price  (i.e. not much more than a large latte from one of the  big coffee houses) it's well worth buying,
